description: Wikitext is a document written in a wiki markup language. This extension provides functional support for the Wikitext language with MediaWiki such as Wikipedia.
wikitext.getPreview.title: Get preview
wikitext.getDiff.title: Get diff
wikitext.login.title: Login with your account
wikitext.logout.title: Logout, if you are already logged in
wikitext.readPage.title: Pull page to edit
wikitext.readPageAndReplace.title: Pull page to edit and replace current editor
wikitext.writePage.title: Post your edit to the website
wikitext.viewPage.title: View the page
wikitext.citeWeb.title: Add a web citation
wikitext.closeEditor.title: Close this editor without saving
wikitext.host.description: The host that provides the API, such as 'en.wikipedia.org'.
wikitext.userName.description: The user name of wikimedia site.
wikitext.password.description: The password of user. It will be fixed in the software settings, please do not fill in the device in public places.
wikitext.redirects.description: When the input page is a redirect page, jump automatically.
wikitext.converttitles.description: Convert titles to other variants if necessary. Only works if the wiki's content language supports variant conversion.
wikitext.apiPath.markdownDescription: Set the basic path to obtain the API. If you are not sure, please check the `Special:Version` page of your site.
wikitext.getCss.description: Get CSS when previewing the page. Please note that this feature will greatly increase the extended workload, and some rendering effects may conflict with VSCode. To get the correct display, you may need to enable Previewer's JS support.
wikitext.enableJavascript.description: Enable Previewer's JS support. This feature may affect the performance of VSCode and introduce potential security risks.
wikitext.articlePath.markdownDescription: Set the basic path to obtain the article. please check the `Special:Version` page of your site (No need for `$1`).
wikitext.webCiteFormat.markdownDescripti:
Setting the generation of web reference tags. The configuration of this option is similar to the code section of MakeRef in meta wikimedia. The available fields: `author`, `url`, `title`, `accessdate`, `website`, `publicationdate`, `archiveurl` , `archivedate`, and `language`.

**This function is only a preview function, it may change or become a separate new extension in the future. Please pay attention to the changelog of this function every time you update this extension.**
wikitext.webCiteArchive.description: Fetching archive link from Wayback Machine when generating web references.
wikitext.webCiteAuthorSelector.markdownD: CSS Selectors for `author` field. Seperated by `,`.
wikitext.webCiteTitleSelector.markdownDe: CSS Selectors for `title` field. Seperated by `,`.
wikitext.webCiteDateSelector.markdownDes: CSS Selectors for `publicationdate` field. Seperated by `,`.
wikitext.transferProtocol.description: Select the transfer protocol used when accessing the API.
wikitext.previewCssStyle.markdownDescrip: CSS attached to Previewer. This content always works, regardless of whether [GetCss](#wikitext.getCss) is enabled or not. To enable CSS for a specific category of themes, you can use the class filter name `vscode-light`, `vscode-dark`, `vscode-high-contrast` etc. See [Extension guides](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/extension-guides/webview#theming-webview-content) to learn more.
wikitext.autoLogin.always: Always log in automatically when I am not logged in
wikitext.autoLogin.askMe: Ask me if I want to log in when I am not logged in
wikitext.autoLogin.description: Log in automatically when interacting with the wiki.
wikitext.skipEnteringPageTitle.markdownD: If `PageTitle` is filled in `PAGE_INFO`, skip entering the title when posting.
